divs: Sighting DetailsWhile driving east on State Route 715 in Wolfe County, Kentucky at between 10:30 and 11:00 pm on Thursday March 3rd 2011, I witnessed a quick, bright, green streak coming down in the northeast sky. The event lasted approximately two seconds. I can't say how long the trail was but it dissipated quickly. I didn't hear any unusual sounds during the event. My vehicle windows were closed. I was driving at an approximate speed of fifty mph. I witnessed this event through the windshield. I can't remember if it was cloudy or not but it was clear with no rain or snow. I saw no other anomalous in the sky that night. I first took the falling green light to be a meteorite, thus the reason in the delayed reporting of it.
trends: There have been no other sightings in rogers
This sighting has never been favorited.
Summary: witnessed possible meteorite in northeast sky between 10:30 and 11:00 pm event lasted approximately two seconds
